items.title: AbortController, your newest friend
items.content:
#â€‹594 â€” June 17, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

AbortController is Your Friend (for Cancelling Async Tasks andÂ More) â€” AbortController provides a way to abort web requests at any point without waiting for a response, but itâ€™s possible to apply its handy mechanism to other use cases, as shownÂ here.

Sam Thorogood

Microvium: A Tiny JavaScript Engine for Microcontrollers â€” How tiny? Try 8.5 KB and needing just 34 bytes of RAM at idle. Despite neat projects like Espruino, JS has never been a natural fit for constrained environments but Microvium, Elk and low.js are working hard at the problem. Hereâ€™s how Microvium works and the obligatory GitHubÂ repo.

Michael Hunter

Couchbase Capella DBaaS: Store in JSON, Access with SQL â€” Build faster with in-memory performance, automatic replication and scaling. Try it now for free and be live in under threeÂ minutes

Couchbase sponsor

Vitest: A Vite-Powered 'Blazing Fast' Unit Testing Framework â€” Brings a lot of cool stuff into one place and really is quick â€“ if you want near instant feedback when you change your code, check it out. You get Viteâ€™s transformers, resolvers, and plugins, snapshot testing, native code coverage, component testing, an instant watch mode, andÂ more.

Vitest

IN BRIEF:

  • â­ï¸ Last week, Vue.js's creator gave â–¶ï¸ a 'State of the Union'-style address on the project (plus Vite) for Vue.js Amsterdam.

  • ğŸ‘¾ OneJS is an intriguing JavaScript-based scripting engine for building UIs in the Unity game engine. There's some example code of using it to create a UI on top of aÂ game.

  • Someone scraped 1 million top domains to analyze what JS libraries they're relying upon. There's a lot of data or just enjoy this summary graphic showing that jQuery leads the way! Ken Wheeler's Slick also does very well. WordPress seems to have a big influenceÂ here.

  • ğŸ“† Sails is a MVC-oriented webapp framework for Node and an online Sails event, Sailsconf, is taking place on YouTube on June 22-24 (nextÂ Weds-Fri).

  • The end-of-life date for Node.js 16 has been brought forward to September 2023 to coincide with the EOL of OpenSSL 1.1.1.

RELEASES:

Prettier 2.7 â€“ Now supports TypeScript 4.7 syntax.
Lerna 5.1 â€“ JS monorepo management now even faster.
Strapi 4.2 â€“ Node.js headless CMS.
Octokit.js 1.8.0 â€“ GitHub SDK for Node, Deno and browsers.
Inferno 8.0 â€“ Fast React-like UI library.
Boa 0.15 â€“ Experimental JS parser and compiler in Rust.
Ember.js 4.5
Node.js v18.4.0 â€“ Minor cleanups.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineers â€” Sticker Mule is the Internet's most "kick ass" brand. Our software team operates from 17 countries, and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker mule

Senior Software Engineer at This Dot Labs (Remote, Worldwide) â€” Great benefits working in modern tech stacks and amazing clients such as Google, Meta, Twilio, Cloudinary, Roblox, andÂ more.
This Dot Labs

Senior FullStack Engineer (Vue.js + Node.js) at Lepaya â€” Lepaya is hiring awesome developers like you. Come and help us to empower professionals across theÂ globe.
Lepaya

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

â–¶Â Â How to Remove 99% of JavaScript from the Main Thread â€” The original creator of Angular gives a talk about the Qwik framework which takes a low-JavaScript HTML-first approach to building front-end apps. Partytown gets involved to move scripts into Web Workers, taking them off of the mainÂ thread.

Misko Hevery

Notes on Maintaining an Internal React Component Library â€” A developerâ€™s thoughts on maintaining a component library as part of an existing design system used by a large number of frontend apps atÂ DigitalOcean.

Gabe Scholz

The Complete Guide to Building a React Form in 2022 â€” A good form can be a thing of beauty - and beauty's in the details. Read this blog for everything you need to know about designing & building sleek, user-friendly and accessibleÂ Forms.

Progress KendoReact sponsor

â–¶Â Â Ten Talks from JSConf Budapest 2022 â€” Took place a few weeks ago and these are good quality recordings. Gil Tayarâ€™s talk about the type annotations proposal is a good place toÂ start.

JSConf

â–¶Â Â Zen and the Art of Building a Gmail-like UI with React Native â€” A beautiful (dare we say, zen) screencast with high production values, no spoken words and shot on location at aÂ temple.

Takuya Matsuyama

See How Much Free Time Engineers Have in the State of Engineering TimeÂ Report

Retool: State Of Engineering Time Report sponsor

Using Web Streams on Node.js
Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Component Encyclopedia: A Catalog of 5000+ UI Components â€” Storybook, a UI component devtool, has unveiled a visual catalog of 5,000+ components (mostly React, but some Vue and Web Components) â€“ you donâ€™t need to be a Storybook user as links to repos and demos areÂ provided.

Dominic Nguyen (Storybook)

ow 1.0: Function Argument Validation for Humans â€” A fluent API to define constraints for function arguments (e.g. ow(input, ow.string.minLength(5))) and get nice error messages on failure. Now a pure ESM package. GitHubÂ repo.

Sindre Sorhus

zx v7.0: Better Shell Scripting with JavaScript â€” If writing JavaScript sounds better than wrestling with bash, Perl or Python, zx is for you. v7.0 is rewritten in TypeScript, has an echo function for printing the output of other scripts, within for creating new async contexts, and a new interactive REPL mode (behind -i).

Google

Fx 24.0: A Command-Line JSON Processing Tool â€” If youâ€™ve got some JSON you want to slice and dice, Fx is for you. It was recently rewritten in Go from its original JavaScript but you can still write reducers in JavaScript (or Ruby, or Python) with it. A handyÂ tool.

Anton Medvedev

Studio 3T Manages Your Data, While You Wrestle Your App into Shape â€” Studio 3T's full suite of MongoDB tools lets you query quicker, develop with data even faster and turn queries into code automatically. Try it free for 30 days - no credit cardÂ needed.

Studio 3T sponsor

Moon: A New Build System for the JavaScript Ecosystem â€” Built in Rust for performance, Moon appears to be focused on features for larger projects that may have lots of dependencies, developers, and processes to balance. Itâ€™ll be interesting to see this one developÂ further.

Miles Johnson

public-ip 6.0: Quickly Get Your Public IP Address â€” Works in both Node and the browser and uses different approaches on each. v6 lets you choose between IPv6 andÂ IPv4.

Sindre Sorhus

items.title: Mathematics is the music of reason.
items.content:
#â€‹593 â€” June 10, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Mathematical Notation Explained with JavaScript â€” Math has its own fascinating world of notation but if it feels a bit opaque to you, this post will help. It boils down numerous areas of mathematical notation into JavaScript equivalents making it easier to follow whatâ€™s goingÂ on.

Haas Labs Ltd

â• The math fun doesn't stop here â€“ check out Code & Tools below for a neat project (KaTeX) for rendering math notation on the Web very quickly.

'JavaScript Hydration is a Workaround, Not a Solution' â€” Is hydration, as offered by many newer frameworks, unnecessary overhead? MiÅ¡ko, the inventor of Angular, explains why he thinks so and shares the strategy the Qwik framework usesÂ instead.

MiÅ¡ko Hevery

JavaScript Scratchpad for VS Code, Now with Online Sharing â€” Quokka.js is the #1 tool for exploring and testing JavaScript. Code runs immediately as you type. The new online sharing feature allows you to share your code and replay its execution (including runtimeÂ values).

Wallaby.js sponsor

Plasmo: 'It's Like Next.js for Browser Extensions' â€” A React and TypeScript oriented framework for building your own browser extensions complete with live-reloading, automated deployment to the main browser extension marketplaces,Â etc.

Plasmo

IN BRIEF:

  • The latest VS Code update is out. TypeScript 4.7 is included and, more excitingly, Go to Definition now jumps to the JS implementation of functions and symbols in external libraries rather than the type definitions.

  • ğŸ˜† Last week we linked to a guy who made a graphical game in Word with JavaScript using Office Add-Ins - he's back again â–¶ï¸ implementing Wordle in Word. It's nice to see someone having some fun.

  • DOOM? We recently linked to Sliderland, a curious minimalist JS coding playground â€“ its creator has now created a DOOM-like game on top of it(!)

  • SAFARI: Apple's developer conference, WWDC, is currently underway and new WebKit/Safari features are on show in Safari 16 Beta. There's support for Web Inspector Extensions and support for Shared Workers, service workers that can be shared between browsingÂ contexts. We can expect Web Push support in 2023,Â too.

  • Astro 1.0 was expected this week but the release of the novel static site builder is being pushed back to late July.

  • GitHub is introducing the idea of Achievements where you earn badges for achieving as yet undefined goals.

RELEASES:

Flicking 4.9 â€“ Flexible web carousel control.
Bree 9.0 â€“ Node.js job scheduler.
Jasmine 4.2 â€“ Testing framework.
EmojiMart 5.1 â€“ Emoji picker control.
Puppeteer 14.3

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineer at Blueground (Remote) â€” Help us build the worldâ€™s leading next-gen platform for home rentals and shape the future ofÂ living.
Blueground

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

JavaScript of Halftone Printing â€” A delightful, practical and interactive walk through whatâ€™s involved reproducing a classic halftone style printing process using basic JavaScript and aÂ canvas.

Andy Bayer

Building Framework Interoperable Web Components â€” If you use different frameworks like React, Svelte, Vue, etc. itâ€™s common to pick a component library that suits each one, but what if you could write such components once in a framework agnostic way and use them wherever you want? Web Components provides anÂ approach.

Adam Rackis

Creating an Ultrasonic Payments System with JavaScript â€” A fun experiment with ultrasonic data transmission betweenÂ devices.

Charlie Gerard

Take the Misery Out of JavaScript Security

Feroot Security sponsor

â–¶Â Â RedwoodJS Explained in 100 Seconds â€” RedwoodJS is a full-stack JS framework backed by one of GitHubâ€™s cofounders and not to be sleptÂ on.

Fireship

Running Windows/ARM on Apple Silicon Macs via UTM â€” Are you a macOS user who wants to spin up Windows to see how Node.js works there, how tooling feels, etc? Dr. Axel has someÂ tips.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

Should You Use Framer Motion or Motion One for Animation? â€” The author of both Framer Motion and Motion One compares and contrasts the two JavaScript animation libraries. Framer Motion is the way to go for React but Motion One is moreÂ agnostic.

Matt Perry

The Best Way to Cache API Responses with Angular and RxJs
Tomas Trajan

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

KaTeX 0.16.0: The Fastest Math Typesetting Library for the Web â€” Hundreds of expressions to render on a single page? No problemo and no dependencies either despite supporting many TeX functions. Thereâ€™s a sandbox demoÂ page.

Emily Eisenberg and Sophie Alpert

Timeline JS: Create Useful Timelines for the Web â€” Built by a journalism lab at a university, this is not aimed at expert developers but folks who just need to tell a story or show off some data online. Hereâ€™s an example showing a timeline of Whitney Houstonâ€™sÂ life.

Northwestern University Knight Lab

Self-Hosted, Open-Source Firebase Alternative â€” Appwrite provides APIs that cover your core backend needs. Build secure and fast with Appwrite. Click to learnÂ more.

Appwrite sponsor

Fastify 4.0 Released: A Node.js Webapp Framework â€” The first major release of a popular, high performance Node.js Web framework in two years warrants some celebration. A focus has been placed on stabilization, modernization, and improving the already quite stable developer experience, rather than flashy new features, although this post does cover a fewÂ updates.

Fastify Team

pretty-ms: Convert Milliseconds to Human Readable Strings â€” 1337000000 â†’ 15d 11h 23mÂ 20s

Sindre Sorhus

The Best JavaScript and CSS Animation Libraries for UI Designers â€” Runs through nine animation options covering strengths and weaknesses and when to choose eachÂ one.

Alex Walker

qnm: CLI Utility for Looking at node_modules Directories â€” The goal is to make it easier to see whatâ€™s going on in a node_modules directory of choice including letting you search for packages. Supports both npm andÂ Yarn.

Ran Yitzhaki

Project Management for Today's (and Tomorrow's) Software Teams

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

is-online 10.0: Check if The Internet Connection is Up â€” Works in both Node.js and the browser and uses different approaches to check if the Internet is really available. Now a pure ESÂ module.

Sindre Sorhus

Awesome Readme Template: A README Template for GitHub Projects
Louis-Kaan Ay

math.gl: Math Modules for Geospatial and 3D/WebGL Visualization Use Cases
Uber

items.title: Sure, you can make games in Word with JavaScript now.
items.content:
Don't miss the link with a â­ï¸ next to it in this issue, I promise it's goodÂ :-)

#â€‹592 â€” June 3, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Angular v14 Released â€” A key release for the long standing JavaScript framework thatâ€™s used in far more places than most JavaScript developers realize (especially in larger companies). Some of whatâ€™sÂ new:

  • Standalone components for a simpler authoring experience.
  • Strictly typed reactive forms.
  • Improved change detection.
  • Improvements â–¶ï¸ to accessibility.
And more, naturally. If you're eating lunch right now, you can get a roundup of what's going on with Angular right now in â–¶ï¸ this 'State of Angular' explainer (16 minutes).

Emma Twersky and the Angular Team

Monorepos in JavaScript and TypeScript â€” A comprehensive introduction and tutorial on using monorepos (explained here also) with JavaScript including their benefits and how to create and manage one withÂ Yarn.

Robin Wieruch

Studio 3T Manages Your Data, While You Wrestle Your App into Shape â€” Studio 3T's full suite of MongoDB tools lets you query quicker, develop with data even faster and turn queries into code automatically. Try it free for 30 days - no credit cardÂ needed.

Studio 3T sponsor

Jest Image Snapshot: A Jest Matcher for Image Comparisons â€” Say hello to visual regression testing using this tool from American Express. Take image snapshots of your app within a test and compare them against a baseline. It can even handle tolerances if you want to ignore subtle changes and only throw on hugeÂ discrepancies.

American Express

IN BRIEF:

  • Vue 2.7 will be the final minor release of Vue 2.x and its estimated 'end of life' date will be at the end of 2023, according to slides shown at Vue.jsÂ Amsterdam.

  • â­ï¸ I don't insist you click a link very often but you've got to check out EZBitmap.com or at least let its creator explain all â–¶ï¸ in this video. This is the one link in this issue I think will put a smile on your face - it's a funny idea and works surprisingly well..

  • ğŸ‘¾ A fun look at some of the best games (and their source code) from the recent Gamedev.js Jam event.

  • Node 18.3.0 is out and introduces (experimentally) a new util.parseArgs function for parsing command lineÂ arguments.

  • Looking for alternatives to your least favorite npm packages? pkg.land is a new site that's worth a try.

RELEASES:

  • RE:DOM 3.28.0 â€“ Tiny (2KB) UI library.
  • gl-react 5.2 â€“ WebGL shaders in React.
  • lint-staged 13.0 â€“ Run linters against staged git files.
  • AVA 4.3.0 â€“ Node.js test runner.
  • Recoil 0.7.3 â€“ Alternative state management for React from Facebook.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Software Engineer at Blueground (Remote) â€” Help us build the worldâ€™s leading next-gen platform for home rentals and shape the future ofÂ living.
Blueground

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

â–¶Â Â Sure, You Can Make Games in Microsoft Word with JavaScriptÂ Now â€” Office Add-ins is a mechanism for scripting Office apps with JavaScript. You could use this for something useful or, if youâ€™re as smart as this fellow, you could create a graphical game that uses a Word document for aÂ canvas.

SethEric

You May Not Need a Bundler for Your npm-Distributed Library.. â€” Colin makes a good argument to run as cleanly as possible, but there are plenty of links to other options, if youÂ prefer.

Colin Diesh

Auth Considerations for Kubernetes - Free eBook â€” We'll cover topics like service-to-service communication, RBAC, OIDC mapping, and more. Download the eBookÂ today.

FusionAuth sponsor

â–¶Â Â An Introduction to Vue.js State Management with Pinia â€” Pinia is now Vueâ€™s official state management library (it was previously Vuex) and Tyler does a great job of sharing his excitement for it here. (23Â minutes.)

Tyler Potts

How To Build a Group Chat App with Vanilla JS, Twilio and Node â€” If you donâ€™t want to put together all the backend infrastructure yourself.. outsourceÂ it.

Zara Cooper

Compiling a Subset of JavaScript to ARM Assembly in Haskell â€” One of those things youâ€™ll probably never need to do but might want to do given enough time andÂ inclination.

Micah Cantor

New Express 5 Features to Try â€” Express 5 has been in beta for.. quite a while now.
Zara Cooper

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

Svelvet: A Svelte Component Library for Interactive Node-Based Diagrams â€” You can create intuitive flow diagrams using pre-built components with seamless zooming and panning, draggable interactivity, customizable edges/nodes, etc.

Sharma, Widjaja, Willett, and Zambrano

No Engineer Wants to Build and Rebuild Notification Templates and Infrastructure â€” Drive team collaboration and prevent customer churn with notification design studio and API. Make automationÂ workflows.

Courier sponsor

Shaka Player 4.1: Library for Playing Adaptive Media â€” Plays formats like DASH and HLS in the browser sans plugins or Flash. It can also play media offline by way ofÂ IndexedDB.

Shaka Project

Glide Data Grid 4: A Fast Data Grid for React Projects â€” Bills itself as a â€œno compromise, outrageously fast data gridâ€ that can support up to millions of rows with rich rendering and TypeScript support. The homepage features a neat demo and itâ€™s MIT licensed too. GitHubÂ repo.

Glide

Terser: JavaScript 'Mangler' and Compressor Toolkit for ES6+ â€” A minifier you can use from Node or the command line. It strips out comments, squeezes down variable names, removes whitespace, and replaces various code patterns with smaller variants. Thereâ€™s an online playground if you want to see what itâ€™ll do to your code ofÂ choice.

Mihai Bazon

Free Activity Feeds & Chat APIs for Qualifying Teams

Stream sponsor

Color Legend Element: A Web Component Providing a Legend in Data Visualizations â€” Built with Lit/Lit-Element and D3.js. You can see various examples here. Itâ€™s legen.. wait for it.. dary.

Chris Henrick

highlighted-code: A <textarea> with Automatic Syntax Highlighting â€” Try it live here. The API lets you customize language, tab size, and whether the textarea should auto-expand toÂ fit.

Andrea Giammarchi

Scriptable: Automate iOS with JavaScript â€” There are a few options in this space, but this is a nicely self contained one with a built in editor, examples scripts, and that supportsÂ ES6.

Simon StÃ¸vring

collect.js: 100+ Convenience Methods for Arrays and Objects â€” A similar API to Laravel Collections: chunk, flatten, shuffle, firstWhere, mapWithKeys, etc. GitHubÂ repo.

Daniel Eckermann
items.contentSnippet:
Don't miss the link with a â­ï¸ next to it in this issue, I promise it's goodÂ :-)


    
    


#â€‹592 â€” June 3, 2022


UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web



JavaScript Weekly




  





  
  
Angular v14 Released â€” A key release for the long standing JavaScript framework thatâ€™s used in far more places than most JavaScript developers realize (especially in larger companies). Some of whatâ€™sÂ new:
    
Standalone components for a simpler authoring experience.
Strictly typed reactive forms.
Improved change detection.

    
Improvements â–¶ï¸ to accessibility.

    
â–¶ï¸ this 'State of Angular' explainer (16 minutes).

  
Emma Twersky and the Angular Team 


  
  
Monorepos in JavaScript and TypeScript â€” A comprehensive introduction and tutorial on using monorepos (explained here also) with JavaScript including their benefits and how to create and manage one withÂ Yarn.
Robin Wieruch 


  
  
Studio 3T Manages Your Data, While You Wrestle Your App into Shape â€” Studio 3T's full suite of MongoDB tools lets you query quicker, develop with data even faster and turn queries into code automatically. Try it free for 30 days - no credit cardÂ needed.
Studio 3T sponsor

items.title: Airbnb's uncommon route to faster JS builds
items.content:
#â€‹591 â€” May 27, 2022

UnsubscribeÂ Â |Â Â Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Comparing Three Ways of Processing Arrays Non-Destructively â€” The good doctor of JavaScript puts for-of, .reduce(), and .flatMap() up against each other so you can pick which makes the most sense for your own array processingÂ work.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

npm Security Update: What GitHub's Learnt About April's Attack â€” Last month, GitHub, the stewards of the npm registry, reported that stolen OAuth tokens were used to access certain private repositories, private package manifests & metadata, as well as npm user account data. Here's an update. Notably: â€œGitHub discovered a number of plaintext user credentials for the npm registry that were captured in internal logs following the integration of npm into GitHub logging systems.â€ Ouch. Don't store secrets or credentials in version control (or logs).

Greg Ose (GitHub)

Making TypeScript 'Stick' â€” Test your knowledge through quizzes, challenges, and even a TypeScript gameshow in this new course by MikeÂ North!

Frontend Masters sponsor

TypeScript 4.7 Released â€” The headline feature for the typed JavaScript superset is ES module support for Node.js â€“Â a feature that has been infamously difficult to implement, and whose reliance on file extensions continues to provokeÂ debate â€“ plus CommonJS interoperability (from ES modules), improved function inference, control-flow analysis for bracketed element access, and more.

Daniel Rosenwasser

Next.js's Layouts RFC: Big Changes Ahead for Next.js â€” If youâ€™re a Next.js user, youâ€™ll want to read this as some significant updates are on the way, particularly around routing, app structure, and layouts (including nestedÂ layouts).

Neutkens, Markbage, et al. (Vercel)

IN BRIEF:

  • DigitalOcean has launched a new serverless functions-as-a-service platform â€“ yes, you can run your JS code on it.

  • Angular 14 (currently in RC phase) is due imminently â€“ a look at what's new.

  • Netlify has hired Ryan Carniato, the founder of the SolidJS project, to work on it full-time â€“ here's his story.

  • Node 17 goes 'end of life' next week, joining Node 12 which went EOL inÂ April.

  • GitHub Actions can now use Node 16 â€“ Node 12 support remains forÂ now.

  • Ghost is a Node.js-built CMS and blogging platform that has become an ecosystem and business all of its own, and there's a new major version out now: Ghost 5.0

RELEASES:

  • Electron 19 â€“ Gets Chromium 102, V8 10.2, and Node 16.14.2.
  • Neutralino.js 4.6 â€“ Lightweight cross-platform desktop app framework.
  • fast-check 3.0 â€“ Property based testing framework.
  • Knex 2.1.0 â€“ SQL builder for Node.js.
  • Cypress 9.7.0 â€“ Testing for anything in a browser.
  • Storybook 6.5 â€“ UI component dev tool.

ğŸ’» Jobs

Senior Vue.js Developer (Remote-Friendly) â€” Software Development Agency in WrocÅ‚aw, Poland working with experts from around the globe to create meaningfulÂ software.
Monterail

Software Engineers â€” Sticker Mule is the Internet's most "kick ass" brand. Our software team operates from 17 countries, and we're always looking for more exceptionalÂ engineers.
Sticker mule

JavaScript Developer at X-Team (Remote) â€” Join the most energizing community for developers and work on long-term projects for Riot Games, FOX, Sony, Coinbase, andÂ more.
X-Team

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired â€” Create a profile on Hired to connect with hiring managers at growing startups and Fortune 500 companies. It's free forÂ job-seekers.
Hired

ğŸ“’Â Articles & Tutorials

What is 'Edge Compute?' 'It's Kind of Like Knitting Dog Hats' â€” Look, the metaphor made us laugh, and the author stretches it out quite a long way here. â€œCloud functions are like robots trained to knit dog-hatsâ€ â€“ gotÂ it?

Austin Gil

How Airbnb Gets Faster JavaScript Builds with Metro â€” The story of Airbnbâ€™s migration from Webpack to Metro (a JavaScript bundler aimed at React Native â€“ but Airbnb uses it for Web projects) and how it made their development feedback loop â€˜nearlyÂ instantaneousâ€™.

Rae Liu

Dark Patterns in UX â€” Higher-order functions are an important feature that cannot be overlooked in functional programming, allowing for easy nesting of functions to archive a specific task. Learn more about them from thisÂ article.

Kendo UI for Angular sponsor

How We Converted Our Node.js Library to Deno (using Deno) â€” â€œWe landed on a â€œruntime adapterâ€ pattern that we think represents a general-purpose approach that may be useful to other library authors looking to supportÂ Deno.â€

James Clarke (EdgeDB)

A Roundup of React State Management Libraries in 2022 â€” There are a lot of options in this space including Zustand, Recoil, XState and, of course, Redux.

Albert Gao

JSON and the Stringification Oddities in JavaScript â€” Itâ€™s not the most straightforward thing, although there is at least a (complicated) written spec for JSON.stringifyâ€™sÂ operation.

Zhenghao

The Balance Has Shifted Away From SPAs â€” â€œhow the context has changed in recent years to give MPAs more of an upper hand against SPAsâ€. (MPAs are Multi-Page Apps. Or just â€˜appsâ€™ toÂ me.)

Nolan Lawson

Add a Professional Scheduling Widget to Your MES App

Bryntum sponsor

Avoiding Puppeteer Antipatterns
Greg Gorlen

5 Things That Make Astro Unique for Building Web Apps
Brian Rinaldi

ğŸ› Â Code & Tools

ğŸ¥· Â Ninja Keys: Add a Command Palette / Keyboard Shortcuts Interface to Your App/Site â€” If youâ€™ve used Cmd/Ctrl+K on GitHub or the command palette in tools like VS Code, this will feel familiar to you and itâ€™s at home in vanilla JS apps or alongside Vue, React or Svelte. Try it here. Kbar is another player in this space focused more onÂ React.

Sergei Sleptsov

Filesize.js: Generate Human Readable Strings From File Sizes â€” For example, 123456 bytes could turn into "120.56 KB" - though different standards of conversion can also be used. GitHubÂ repo.

Jason Mulligan

LunchboxJS: A Custom Vue 3 Renderer for Three.js â€” Straight in with a snazzy full-page demo here. The docs may prove more useful after checking it out. â€œThink of it like react-three-fiber forÂ Vue.â€

Breakfast Studio LLC

Try the CI/CD Tool Used by Shopify, Pinterest, and Lyft â€” Join the best engineering teams running the fastest, most reliable build and deploy pipelines at scale. Now with a freeÂ plan.

Buildkite sponsor

React-Uploady 1.0: File Upload Components and Hooks â€” Aims to be simple while highly customizable. You can have a file upload button, a preview, a zone for drag and drop uploads, and more. The docs are good and show off a basic example and thereâ€™s a screencast too.

Yoav Niran

EStimator.dev: The Modern JavaScript Savings Calculator â€” Calculate the size improvement a site could achieve by switching to more modern JavaScriptÂ syntax.

Google Chrome Labs

Browser Extension Template: Quickly Flesh Out a Browser Extension Codebase â€” Think create-react-app but for an extension, kinda.

Debdut Karmakar

Nuxt Content v2: A Nuxt Module That Uses Markdown, YAML, CSV or JSON Files From a content Directory
Chopin, Guilloux, Birang, and Ollivier

title: JavaScript Weekly
description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects
